image.altText: Sheep graze in a dusty paddock while a huge plume of smoke rises from the mountains behind them.

props.synopsis: Temperatures are forecast to reach the mid-40s across Victoria on Boxing Day, with fire conditions in the state expected to mirror those of the 2019/20 bushfires.

title.children: Total fire ban issued for Victoria ahead of expected Boxing Day blazes

image.altText: A man stands in front of CFA helmets in a shed

props.synopsis: Country Victorian firefighters are driving into another high-risk season in tankers that they say are well past their use-by date.

title.children: No toilets and 30-year-old trucks but CFA volunteers forced to pay huge levies

image.altText: Pistachios with their hulls split open sit in a red bowl, surrounded by green and red Christmas tinsel

props.synopsis: Australia's pistachio industry has gradually established itself and now with a record harvest, and a new facility, it is looking for new markets overseas.

title.children: Australian pistachios crack a record harvest

image.altText: A composite photo of Victorian opposition leader John Pesutto and former Liberal MP Moira Deeming.

props.synopsis: A group of Liberal MPs signed the call for a special meeting to vote on Mr Pesutto's leadership and whether to readmit Moira Deeming to the party room.

title.children: John Pesutto to face leadership spill motion within Victorian Liberals

image.altText: Four beers on a table, with tinsel in the foreground

props.synopsis: Australia's summer holiday period often heralds celebration and cheer but, for sobriety coach Noelene Brown and many others, it can make for a lot of "tricky" social situations.

title.children: What to say if you're offered a drink as a non-drinker this festive season

image.altText: A roast turkey sitting on a white plate surrounded by greens

props.synopsis: Turkey is in decline, chicken is on the rise and ham remains popular for Christmas lunch in Australia.

title.children: Christmas lunch is changing as Aussies opt for cheaper cuts of meat

image.altText: India bowler Jasprit Bumrah in his run-up at training ahead of the Boxing Day Test against Australia at the MCG.

props.synopsis: The forecast for a 40-degrees Celsius day one could mean the MCG pitch quickens up faster than usual, which could spell trouble for Australia with Jasprit Bumrah on fire.

title.children: Fast bowlers should be excited by Boxing Day Test pitch, curator says

image.altText: Destroyed bus front on road way with rear of truck involved in foreground of the image.

props.synopsis: A fatal accident involving a bus in southern New South Wales prompts call for a national campaign on bus seatbelt safety.

title.children: Seatbelts on buses comes under scrutiny after Hume Highway crash

image.altText: Matt Gaetz stands at a podium and speaks.

props.synopsis: An investigation has uncovered "substantial evidence" that former congressman Matt Gaetz, who Donald Trump had hoped to make US attorney-general, paid for sex with a 17-year-old girl.

title.children: Matt Gaetz paid for sex, including with 17yo, ethics report alleges

image.altText: Ismail Haniyeh puts his right index finger across his stubbled chin as he tilts his head down slightly and looks forwards.

props.synopsis: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz has admitted for the first time publicly to Israel's killing of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh.

title.children: Israel confirms it killed Hamas's top political leader in Iran

image.altText: Boat surrounded by sharks in blue ocean

props.synopsis: Two mates launched a drone to get a better view of their boat only to find themselves surrounded by more than a dozen sharks. A marine biologist suggests their engine noise was the main attraction.

title.children: Dramatic drone footage shows fishermen's tinnie surrounded by sharks

image.altText: The exterior of the Supreme Court of South Australia.

props.synopsis: A court has ruled the body of a teenager — whose death is being investigated as murder — be cremated against his mother's wishes.

title.children: Court orders murdered teenager be cremated against his mother's wishes

image.altText: A man looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market ends the day higher after a rally on Wall Street, while the Australian dollar remains at a two-year low. Look back on how the session played out.

title.children: ASX rises after a rally on Wall Street, Australian dollar remains at two-year low — as it happened

image.altText: An illustration of an Afghan man sitting on the floor using a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Mohammed Sorosh, who is being sought by the Taliban for helping an Australian NGO rescue scores of vulnerable people from Afghanistan, faces a years-long wait before his application for a humanitarian visa will be processed.

title.children: 'Every moment, I am afraid': Calls to prioritise Afghans 'most at risk' for humanitarian visas

image.altText: Polynesian woman wears pink flower behind her right ear, holds right hand with tualima up in hang loose sign.

props.synopsis: A Samoan woman is calling for greater acceptance and awareness around cultural tattoos after she was terminated from her workplace due to her tualima, a traditional hand tattoo.

title.children: Hawaiian Airlines employee fired over traditional Samoan tattoo

image.altText: A tall eucalyptus tree at night covered in fairy lights and a star made of lights at the top.

props.synopsis: When an 80-metre gum tree in the Tasmanian forest was due to be cut down for logging, conservationists turned it into the world's tallest Christmas tree.

title.children: The world's tallest Christmas tree still stands today thanks to activists decorating it 25 years ago

image.altText: A man and woman hug, with six children behind them.

props.synopsis: The former fighter pilot was arrested in 2022 on orders from the United States who accused him of breaching arms trafficking laws by training Chinese pilots in South Africa over a decade ago.

title.children: 'My children are very, very sad': Australian pilot Daniel Duggan to be extradited

image.altText: An Australian runner leads a group of runners across the line in her Olympic heat.

props.synopsis: Athletics made the headlines in Australia multiple times in 2024 because the athletes stepped up to another level, catching the attention and the imagination of the nation.

title.children: 2024 a great year for Australian athletics, and all signs point to it getting better

image.altText: Max Purcell serves

props.synopsis: Australian doubles star Max Purcell has voluntarily accepted a provisional suspension after admitting to a breach of doping rules in a medical clinic blunder.

title.children: Two-time grand slam doubles champion Max Purcell handed doping ban

image.altText: An evidence bag containing a metal disc and tape.

props.synopsis: Two men who allegedly tried to steal pre-Christmas mail by "fishing" it out of a letter box in suburban Adelaide have failed to evade the net of police, who charged them with attempted mail theft.

title.children: 'Fishing' device used in attempt to steal mail from Australia Post box, police allege

image.altText: A claymation man, gnome and dog stand outside in front of a large wooden box.

props.synopsis: We first met evil penguin Feathers McGraw in 1993's The Wrong Trousers. Now he's back, seeking revenge on Wallace & Gromit through the spectre of AI.

title.children: The new Wallace & Gromit film gives Mission: Impossible a run for its money

image.altText: A man covered in mud holds turtles

props.synopsis: Col Limpus, 84, has committed most of his life to uncovering mysteries about the majestic sea creatures, including founding the popular Mon Repos Turtle Rookery.

title.children: Retiring turtle champion puts faith in 'high-quality graduates' to take his place

image.altText: A view of a subway door from the inside of a dirty train with orange seats on either side and advertising on the walls

props.synopsis: A suspect is in custody after allegedly setting the victim's clothing alight on the subway early on Sunday morning.

title.children: 'Depraved crime': Woman dies after being set on fire in NYC subway

image.altText: Makoto Uchida and Toshihiro Mibe standing alongside each other at white lecterns in front of a white wall with Honda and Nissan

props.synopsis: A potential merger of Honda and Nissan, and its alliance partners Mitsubishi and Renault SA, could create a new manufacturer worth $79.9 billion, producing 8 million cars a year.

title.children: Nissan, Honda announce merger plans to become third-largest car maker

image.altText: Brisbane Broncos NRL player Ezra Mam.

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Broncos star who was last week found guilty of drug-driving and driving without a licence will likely face a ban from the NRL, but the details of the league's proposed punishment cannot be revealed yet.

title.children: Mam hit with NRL breach notice, but proposed punishment not yet known

image.altText: A close up of a large crocodile swimming in clear water.

props.synopsis: Burt the crocodile, known for his role in the iconic Australian film Crocodile Dundee, has died at Darwin's Crocosaurus Cove.

title.children: Celebrity crocodile from Crocodile Dundee dies in his 90s

image.altText: Donald Trump wears a blue suit and red tie as he looks to his side while standing at a podium

props.synopsis: President-elect Donald Trump muses about regaining US control over the Panama Canal, accusing Panama of charging excessive fees for use of the waterway.

title.children: Donald Trump threatens to retake control of Panama Canal

image.altText: Office workers cross the street in Sydney

props.synopsis: It has been a year where people have experienced vastly differing fortunes. Leading economists say 2024's conditions centred on the impact of interest rates being used to tame inflation, and a "per capita" recession.

title.children: 'Very different for different people': The divergent, crushing economics of 2024

image.altText: A man between large rocks in a river holds on to one end of a yellow rope

props.synopsis: First responders and the Lithuanian Ambassador to Australia meet with the man who had his leg amputated after being trapped for over 20 hours in Tasmania's Franklin River while on a rafting adventure.

title.children: Man who had leg amputated in Franklin River rafting trip meets rescuers

image.altText: A naval patrol boat sits at a dock in an Australian shipyard

props.synopsis: Just one month after being handed over, a patrol boat given to the Fiji Navy by Australia has been damaged while docking.

title.children: Fiji naval vessel gifted by Australia sustains damage during docking

image.altText: A home destroyed by rocks that fell down a hill in a landslide.

props.synopsis: Vanuatu's deadly magnitude-7.3 earthquake has forced 1,700 people from their homes, with many still sleeping out in the open as weather forecasts predict heavy rain will hit Port Vila.

title.children: Flooding, landslide fears as severe weather stalks earthquake-struck Vanuatu

image.altText: a photo of a woman with blonde hair in her house looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Domestic violence agencies say old, unused phones could save lives as they respond to increasing demand for "safe phones" for survivors.

title.children: 'Safe phones' the key to saving lives in abusive relationships

image.altText: Divvy van parked in a suburban driveway

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old boy has been charged over the death of a man in Melbourne's west.

title.children: Teen charged with murder after death at Kurunjang

image.altText: A police car outside a house.

props.synopsis: A second man has been charged over deaths of two people at Rye earlier this month.

title.children: Second charge laid over fatal double shooting south of Melbourne

image.altText: a photo of a teenaged boy leaning against a car in a dairy farm paddock with a cow in background

props.synopsis: A charity that runs an early intervention program for vulnerable boys in regional areas says it's changing their lives and transforming their communities.

title.children: At-risk boys just need 'someone to believe in them' to transform their lives
